page.title: 01The Camps.
page.content: { Castle Camps}and{Shudy Camps}are two small villages in the south east corner of Cambridgeshire.There are one or two other scattered communities in the area consisting of small groups of houses, for example the eight houses in Nosterfield End.The villages are attractive and have grown in recent years. This whole area is intensively farmed,with Wheat,Oil Seed Rape and Barley the main crops.Peas and Potatoes are also grown. The countryside is gently undulating,open,with few trees.Fields are large,hedges few.Footpaths abound,but many have been ploughed up. Transport is exclusively by road or on foot.Families shop mostly in Haverhill or Cambridge,as there are only three shops in this area.
